t: Psalm 83
A Song or Psalm of Asaph.
Keep*p not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
For,*p lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
They*p have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.
They*p have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
For*p they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee:
The*p tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarites;
Gebal,*p and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
Assur*p also is joined with them: they have holpen the children of Lot. Selah.
Do*p unto them as unto the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kishon:
Which*p perished at Endor: they became as dung for the earth.
Make*p their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:
Who*p said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
O*p my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.
As*p the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;
So*p persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
Fill*p their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O Lord.*s
Let*p them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to shame, and perish:
That*p men may know that thou, whose name alone is Jehovah,*s art the most high over all the earth.
